articles.description: Tyson Fury launched tirade of abuse towards Oleksandr Usyk before the two were separated by security during their face-off in London.
articles.title: Fury & Usyk separated during face-off in London

articles.description: Lawrence Shankland nets in stoppage-time as Scotland keep their slim hopes of topping their Euro 2024 qualifying group alive with a late draw in Georgia.
articles.title: Shankland rescues late point for Scotland in Georgia

articles.description: Australia are through to the World Cup final after a tension-filled three-wicket win over South Africa in Kolkata.
articles.title: Australia beat South Africa in thriller to reach final

articles.description: The Football Association charges Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta with misconduct for comments he made after his side's 1-0 Premier League defeat by Newcastle.
articles.title: Arteta charged by FA for comments after Newcastle loss

articles.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen says he is "not looking forward" to this weekend's Las Vegas Grand Prix, which he believes is "99% show and 1% sporting event".
articles.title: Las Vegas GP is 99% show - Verstappen

articles.description: Rower Hannah Scott explains how a new women's sport research project has helped stop her breaking her ribs and given her back control of her body.
articles.title: 'I have lost count of how many ribs I've broken'

articles.description: Scotland midfielder Scott McTominay criticises Georgia after the sides' 2-2 Euro 2024 qualification draw, calling them "a disgrace".
articles.title: 'Rolling round crying like babies is not football'

articles.description: Britain's Tyson Fury pledges to "break" Ukraine's Oleksandr Usyk when the pair face off in Saudi Arabia on 17 February in a fight to become the first undisputed heavyweight champion in the four-belt era.
articles.title: 'I will break him' - Fury confident he will beat Usyk

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says "something had to give" as he explains his surprise decision to step down from the PGA Tour's Policy Board this week.
articles.title: McIlroy says 'something had to give' after resignation

articles.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold hopes to be a "big part" of England's Euro 2024 plans in midfield as he prepares for Friday's qualifying home game with Malta.
articles.title: Alexander-Arnold wants 'big part' at Euro 2024
